recipe_name: Rosemary Rack of Lamb & Bread Crumbs
instructions: Step 1: Whisk the first 5 ingredients in a glass bowl.
Step 2: Sprinkle lamb with salt and pepper. Cover and let marinate for 4 to 24 hours.
Step 3: Preheat broiler.
Step 4: Remove lamb and broil 2 minutes per side.
Step 5: Mix 1 tablespoon lemon juice, breadcrumbs, and melted butter.
Step 6: Spread mixture onto each chop.
Step 7: Broil chops, not turning, about 4 to 7 minutes until crumbs are golden brown for medium rare.
Step 8: For whole rack, bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then reduce to 375°F for 10 to 15 minutes.
cooking_time: Approximately 30 minutes for chops, 25 to 30 minutes for whole rack
notes: Ensure lamb is marinated for at least 4 hours for best flavor.

instructions: Step 1: In a saucepan, cook chicken broth and flour over medium heat until broth thickens.
Step 2: Lower heat, add salsa, chilis, onion, garlic, salt, and seasonings, and mix well.
Step 3: Dip tortillas in hot mixture to soften.
Step 4: Place a small amount of shredded chicken and cheese in each tortilla (do not overstuff).
Step 5: Roll up and place in a greased 9x13 pan.
Step 6: Add sour cream to hot mixture and mix well.
Step 7: Pour over the tortillas and top with grated cheese.
Step 8: Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes.
notes: Can make ahead—just keep mixture separate until ready to cook.

instructions: Trim bread to fit cheese.
Mix mayonnaise and crab.
Dip sandwich in egg, milk, salt, and pepper.
Fry in oleo until brown.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional instructions or notes are provided.

ingredients.notes: Mix with cottage cheese and Parmesan
Mix with cottage cheese and egg

instructions: Brown sausage, ground beef, and onion together.
Add garlic, parsley flakes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper to the meat mixture. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Mix creamed cottage cheese, egg, and grated Parmesan cheese together for the cheese filling.
Separate crescent rolls into 8 rectangles and place on an ungreased cookie sheet, overlapping edges.
Spread half of the meat mixture down the center of the dough to the end.
Top with cheese filling, then the remaining meat mixture.
Top with mozzarella cheese slices.
Fold up short ends, then pull long sides over top and seal.
Brush with milk and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes.
notes: Recipe from Pillsbury, 1967.

instructions: Step 1: Beat eggs and add salt and flour.
Step 2: Add milk and cheeses, stir.
Step 3: Pour into a 9x13 dish.
Step 4: Bake for 45-50 minutes at 350°F.
Step 5: May be done ahead and baked warm at 350°F for 20 minutes, not as fluffy.
notes: May be prepared ahead of time but will not be as fluffy if reheated.

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 2: In a large bowl, mix together the soups, Rotel, and chicken broth.
Step 3: Layer half of the chicken in a baking dish.
Step 4: Add a layer of tortillas over the chicken.
Step 5: Pour half of the sauce mixture over the tortillas.
Step 6: Repeat the layers with the remaining chicken, tortillas, and sauce.
Step 7: Top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Step 8: Bake uncovered for 1 hour.
notes: Ensure chicken is fully cooked before layering.

instructions: Step 1: Cook chicken, bone and cut into pieces.
Step 2: Blend together mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, Rotel tomatoes and chilies, and broth.
Step 3: Line a 2 1/2 qt casserole dish with layers of chicken, tortillas, onion, cheese, and sauce.
Step 4: Repeat layers, ending with cheese.
Step 5: Bake uncovered at 350°F for 1 hour.
Step 6: Can freeze and reheat.
Step 7: Variation: Use turkey and mushrooms.
notes: Use a 9x13 full casserole dish. Can substitute turkey and mushrooms for variation.

instructions: Wrap ingredients in puff pastry.
Bake.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional instructions or details are provided.

instructions: Let mixture stand over night.
Then bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
Can add shrimp or ham.
notes: Prepared by Lois Culbertson on 1-21-57.

instructions: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
Add garlic and cook until soft but not brown, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and reserve.
Preheat the oven to 350°F.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so additional instructions or details may be missing.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Cook onion in oil for 5 minutes.
Add sausage and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or more.
Add tomato paste, 2 T of parsley, basil, 1/2 t salt, and 1/4 t pepper.
Simmer uncovered over medium-low heat for 15-20 minutes until thickened.
Fill a large bowl with hot water, add noodles, and let sit for 20 minutes.
In a bowl, mix ricotta, goat cheese, 1 cup parmesan, remaining 2 T of parsley, 1/2 t salt, and 1/4 t pepper.
Ladle 1/3 of sauce into a 9x12x2 inch pan.
Layer as follows: 1/2 pasta, mozzarella, ricotta, 1/3 sauce.
Sprinkle with 1/4 cup parmesan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
notes: Use sweet Italian sausage or hot if preferred.

instructions: Step 1: Saute onions and mushrooms in butter.
Step 2: Layer ingredients in baked pie crust.
Step 3: Mix eggs, light cream, nutmeg, salt, pepper, and cheese.
Step 4: Pour mixture on top.
Step 5: Bake 30-35 minutes at 375°F.
Step 6: May use more olives, etc., then bake longer.
Step 7: Use a 9 or 10 inch pie pan.
Step 8: Let sit for 5-10 minutes before serving.
notes: Use a deep dish pie pan, not frozen.

instructions: Step 1: Combine all ingredients except dressing and butter.
Step 2: Spoon mixture into shallow casserole dish (1 1/2 qt).
Step 3: Stir dressing in melted butter and sprinkle over casserole.
Step 4: Bake uncovered at 300°F for 30 minutes.
Step 5: Remove from oven and cover casserole for a few minutes.
notes: For a larger serving, use 1 1/2 recipe for 8 or double for a 9x13 casserole.

instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F.
Cut bread into 1/2 inch slices. Brush with melted butter.
Arrange bread and cheese in layers in a buttered 1/2 quart soufflé dish.
Combine remaining ingredients and pour over bread mixture.
Cover and chill for 6 hours.
Bake uncovered for 1 1/2 hours.
notes: Yummy and easy!

ingredients.notes: mild or medium, depending on the crowd
use Mexican mix, for 9 x 12 casserole

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 2: Cook chicken and cut into pieces.
Step 3: Sauté mushrooms in butter.
Step 4: Cook rice according to package instructions.
Step 5: Mix sour cream with salsa.
Step 6: In a 9 x 12 casserole dish, layer chicken, mushrooms, rice, and salsa mixture.
Step 7: Sprinkle cheese over the top.
Step 8: Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Step 9: Add water chestnuts for crunch if desired.
notes: Adjust salsa spiciness based on preference.

instructions: Blend ingredients and heap in shells.
Top lightly with mayonnaise.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Serve hot or cold.
notes: Recipe from Chesapeake Restaurant.

recipe_name: Broiled Salmon with Mustard Brown Sugar Glaze and Dill
instructions: Step 1: Pat salmon dry and season with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Lay salmon skin side down on broiler pan.
Step 3: Broil for 10-12 minutes.
Step 4: Set glaze in a clean bowl (make extra).
Step 5: At 5 minutes and 8 minutes, brush salmon with glaze.
Step 6: Drizzle remaining glaze over salmon and sprinkle with dill.
Step 7: Serve extra glaze at the table.
notes: Ensure to make extra glaze for serving.

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Step 2: Line a 7x11 (or 9x13) pan with sliced fresh tomatoes.
Step 3: Place flounder on top of the tomatoes.
Step 4: Drizzle lemon juice over the flounder.
Step 5: Pour 1/2 stick of melted butter over the flounder.
Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
Step 7: Top with bread crumbs and lightly sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Step 8: Bake at 450°F for 15-20 minutes.
notes: Drizzle more butter if desired.

instructions: Mix crab, mayonnaise, thyme, Tabasco, and scallions together.
Add bread crumbs to the mixture.
Form into cakes.
Fry in oil until golden brown.
notes: See Barefoot Contessa for additional guidance.

instructions: Place shrimp in a bowl and add the rest of the mixed ingredients.
Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours or more.
Prepare a hot grill.
Remove shrimp and thread on metal skewers.
Place on grill, basting frequently with marinade and turning once until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
notes: Can be served as an appetizer or main course.

instructions: Process cilantro, lime juice, peanuts, ginger, red pepper, olive oil, honey, and salt until smooth.
Saute shrimp and add above mixture.
Serve over rice.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

ingredients.item: Goldcoast Blue Crab or Lobster Spread
ingredients.notes: Use either crab or lobster spread

instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place fish fillets in an oven-proof dish.
Brush the fillets with melted butter.
Bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through.
Combine crab or lobster spread and bread crumbs in a medium bowl.
Remove fish from oven, spread each fillet with the lobster mixture and top with slivered almonds.
Broil until golden brown (Approx. 2-3 minutes).
Place foil pouch in a 400 degree oven for about 20 minutes. Fish will be almost cooked.
Take the fish out, open foil and put oven on broil.
Place back in the oven for a couple of minutes, just to sear up the fish.
Do not overcook at this point.
notes: Ensure not to overcook the fish during the final broiling step.

instructions: Step 1: Cook wild rice as directed on package.
Step 2: While rice is cooking, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan.
Step 3: Sauté carrots, celery, and onions for 3-4 minutes.
Step 4: Stir sautéed vegetables into cooked rice and set aside.
Step 5: Combine soup, sherry, 1/4 cup butter, and seasoning in a double boiler and heat thoroughly.
Step 6: If sauce is too thick, add more sherry.
Step 7: Add lobster to sauce and cook until heated.
Step 8: On individual plates, arrange slices of lobster on rice and spoon sauce over.
Step 9: Serve extra sauce at the table.
notes: Ensure lobster is cooked before adding to the sauce.

instructions: Combine ingredients and coat fillets.
Place in dish and marinate. Cover and refrigerate for 3+ hours.
Grill, broil, and bake, basting as needed.
notes: Reserve marinade for basting.

recipe_name: Creamy Shrimp with Corn and Bacon

ingredients.notes: also try jasmine or long-grain brown rice

instructions: Cook the rice according to the directions on page 150.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel, let cool, then break into pieces. Wipe out the skillet.
Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 4 to 6 minutes. Add the wine and cook until reduced by half, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the cream and bring to a boil. Stir in the shrimp, corn, and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Simmer until cooked through, 4 to 6 minutes. Stir in the bacon; serve over the rice.
notes: The recipe mentions using less if using cooked shrimp, just warm to melt cheese.

instructions: Boil the citrus juices, chicken broth, garlic, sugar, and hot pepper sauce until slightly syrupy and reduced to 1 cup, about 12 minutes. Make ahead and rewarm before using.
Place a rack on a baking sheet.
Whisk the first 6 ingredients in a medium bowl. Add shrimp and toss.
Spread sesame seeds on a pie dish.
Dip shrimp into seeds to coat and place on rack.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet. Add half of the shrimp and sauté until golden brown outside and opaque inside, about 2 minutes. Transfer to plate and repeat.
Divide lettuce on plates, then shrimp. Drizzle with glaze and add mint.
notes: This recipe serves as an appetizer. Make the glaze ahead of time and rewarm before using.

instructions: Step 1: Dice onion and mushrooms. Add Grand Marnier and flame.
Step 2: Bring chicken broth to boil and add cream cheese until melted. Add to rest of the stock.
Step 3: Add onions, mushrooms, and seasonings. Thicken with roux.
Step 4: Sauté shrimp and scallops with wine.
Step 5: Cook fettuccine al dente and place in casserole.
Step 6: Place shrimp and scallops on top. Cover with sauce.
Step 7: Bake at 450°F for 10-13 minutes until golden brown on top.
notes: Optional to add crabmeat. Adjust seasoning to taste.

ingredients.notes: Other fillets like white fish or snapper can be used

instructions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Step 2: Spread the fillets with Cajun seasoning or pesto.
Step 3: Bake at 350°F until cooked through.
Step 4: Optionally, top with nuts.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional information is provided.

instructions: Step 1: Make cream sauce of butter, flour, milk, and sherry.
Step 2: Add mustard. Season to taste with salt and few grains of nutmeg.
Step 3: Mix with crabmeat; add beaten egg yolk and fold in stiffly beaten egg white.
Step 4: Fill seafood shells. Cover with buttered crumbs and bake until mixture is hot and crumbs are brown (about 20 minutes at 400°F—but watch!).
notes: Recipe dated 3-20-57.

instructions: Step 1: Mix the first five ingredients together.
Step 2: Divide the cooked wild rice into 2 shells.
Step 3: Cover the rice with crab meat.
Step 4: Spread the mayonnaise mixture over the top.
Step 5: Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Step 6: Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes.
notes: Doesn't freeze well.

ingredients.notes: Use drained juice, adjust if more juice is available

instructions: Step 1: Cook shrimp according to package directions.
Step 2: Sauté onions and green peppers in salad oil for 3 minutes or more.
Step 3: Mix cornstarch, vinegar, sugar, ginger, soy sauce, and pineapple juice together.
Step 4: Add the mixture to onions and peppers and cook, stirring until thickened.
Step 5: Add pineapple chunks to the sauce.
Step 6: Pour sauce over cooked shrimp and serve on hot rice.
servings: For 2 (use 1 package of shrimp and half the recipe)
notes: Adjust sauce ingredients if more pineapple juice is available.

instructions: Step 1: Let the cream cheese soften.
Step 2: Mix the softened cream cheese with Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, minced onion, salt, and flaked crab meat.
Step 3: Spread the mixture on the rusks.
Step 4: Place a slice of tomato on each rusk.
Step 5: Sprinkle coarse cheddar cheese over the tomato.
Step 6: Add a strip of partially cooked bacon on top.
Step 7: Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional instructions or notes are provided.

instructions: Step 1: Mix all ingredients together.
Step 2: Bake covered for 1 hour (or more) at 350°F.
Step 3: Stir occasionally.
notes: May be made the day before.

ingredients.notes: Board birds and salt pork or bacon to completely cover bird (between leg and breast); discard when cooked
Fill cavity to reduce game taste

instructions: Step 1: Board birds and cover with salt pork or bacon. Fill cavity with apple or onion slices.
Step 2: Roast at 400°F for 20 minutes. Remove meat from bones and keep in equal pieces.
Step 3: Cook for 2 hours until reduced by 1/3 with stock, bones, skin, drippings, and barding.
Step 4: Strain stock (5 cups) and add to 3/4 cup cream sauce and caps of 2 pounds mushrooms.
Step 5: Simmer for 25 minutes, correct seasoning, reduce by 1/3, strain, and add 1/4 cup cognac.
Step 6: Simmer for 10 minutes, arrange meat in 3-quart casserole, pour sauce over.
Step 7: To serve, reheat uncovered in 350°F oven for 45-55 minutes. If frozen, bring to room temperature and reheat.
notes: You may put on a bed of cooked wild rice.

instructions: Step 1: Disjoint pheasant and shake in a bag with seasoned flour.
Step 2: Lay pheasant in a roaster or Dutch oven and place onions around it.
Step 3: Sprinkle pheasant with herbs and dot with butter.
Step 4: Lay celery across pheasant and onions.
Step 5: Pour consommé and red wine into the roaster.
Step 6: Cover and place in a 450°F or 500°F oven for 1 1/2 hours, adding more wine as necessary and basting at least every 1/2 hour.
Step 7: Uncover, turn up the oven for a quick browning, and remove pheasant, onions, and celery to a platter.
Step 8: Put the roaster on top of the stove over medium flame, add more wine, and pour gravy over pheasant, onions, and celery.
cooking_time: 1 1/2 hours plus additional time for browning
notes: Hazeleen lined pan with bacon in the beginning. It was good! Dated 2-15-70.

ingredients.notes: use juice and sections for garnish

instructions: Step 1: Rub ducklings with orange juice before cooking and place half an orange inside each. Remove orange at end.
Step 2: Roast duck at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours. Turn and prick skin frequently to get fat out.
Step 3: For the sauce, put sugar and vinegar in a saucepan and cook until caramelized. Do not burn.
Step 4: Add broth, orange juice, lemon juice, orange rind, salt, and pepper. Mix and keep warm.
Step 5: When duck is tender, remove from oven and drain on a broiling pan. Place skin side down in a baking pan and pour hot sauce over.
Step 6: Return to 350°F for 5 minutes. Drain sauce into pan and keep duck warm.
Step 7: Mix cornstarch with cold water. Arrange duck on a platter and spoon sauce over each piece.
Step 8: Optionally, garnish with orange sections and serve sauce in a dish. Put in casserole at end, pour sauce over, and serve warm.
notes: Garnish with orange sections. Optionally add Grand Marnier at the last moment to the sauce.

instructions: Step 1: Flour and sear the top round.
Step 2: Put in large casserole (crock pot).
Step 3: Add sliced onions, sugar, vinegar, catsup, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and a dash of Tabasco.
Step 4: Cover the casserole.
Step 5: Bake for 3 1/2 hours at 325°F.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Sear the pork tenderloin 3/4 through.
Step 2: Spread Boursin cheese over the tenderloin.
Step 3: Wrap the tenderloin with prosciutto.
Step 4: Wrap the prosciutto-wrapped tenderloin with puff pastry.
Step 5: Bake until the pastry is golden brown.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional information is provided.

instructions: Combine sauce ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes.
During the last hour of roasting, baste the roast with the sauce.
Extra sauce can be served in a dish.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional information is provided.

instructions: Mix and brown the pork chops with flour, salt, paprika, and cleo.
Put in shallow casserole dish.
Cover with pineapple, mandarin oranges, relish, soy sauce, cornstarch, and sugar mixture.
Cover with foil securely.
Bake at 350°F for 1 to 1 1/4 hours.
Serve with rice.
notes: Ensure to drain the mandarin oranges well before use.

instructions: Step 1: Cut the baby back ribs into individual ribs.
Step 2: Prepare the marinade by mixing water, wine (sherry), vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Step 3: Marinate the ribs in the prepared marinade in a bag for 24 hours.
Step 4: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Step 5: Bake the ribs uncovered for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
notes: Ensure ribs are well marinated for best flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Combine all marinade ingredients.
Step 2: Soak pork chops in the marinade for 8-48 hours.
Step 3: Grill over charcoal, basting frequently.
Step 4: Alternatively, bake chops in sauce at 350°F for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
notes: Be Wise guest

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 2: Place the chuck roast in a roasting pan.
Step 3: Mix catsup, open pit, water, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce in a bowl.
Step 4: Pour the mixture over the chuck roast.
Step 5: Cover the roasting pan.
Step 6: Bake in the oven for 3-4 hours.
notes: The recipe is noted as 'yummy'.

ingredients.notes: Spread in bottom of greased mold

instructions: Step 1: Spread brown sugar in the bottom of a greased mold.
Step 2: Add catsup and remaining ingredients.
Step 3: Bake at 350°F.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Combine apple juice, 1/2 cup soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger root, dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, and rum. Marinate pork chops overnight.
Step 2: Drain marinade and add 1/2 cup soy sauce, apple jelly, lemon juice, and nutmeg. Boil until 1/2 cup is left.
Step 3: Grill pork chops 6 inches from heat for 20 minutes or until done, turning halfway. Baste every 5 minutes.
notes: Great marinade, try by Cluchee.

instructions: Step 1: Cook onion, celery, and apple in butter for 5 minutes, until soft but not browned.
Step 2: Remove from heat; add all remaining ingredients except pork roast.
Step 3: Fill roast lightly with stuffing, heaping in center.
Step 4: Roast, uncovered, in moderate oven (325°F) about 4 hours.
Step 5: To be fancy, fasten paper frills to the roast's rib ends.
notes: My choice of wine to accompany this dish: CALIFORNIA ROSÉ. Note: Different and good. For 28 rib crown - triple recipe.

instructions: Step 1: Brown the pork shoulder cubes in 3 tablespoons of oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Add 1 1/2 cups of beef bouillon and cook covered for 45 minutes.
Step 3: Make the sauce by combining cornstarch, sugar, white vinegar, soy sauce, and pineapple juice. Cook until thick.
Step 4: Add green peppers and onions to the sauce and cook until crisp.
Step 5: Add pineapple tidbits to the mixture and combine with the cooked pork.
notes: Recipe by Louise Maxwell

instructions: Step 1: Fry the onion in a skillet.
Step 2: Cook the spaghetti (6 oz. or less) separately.
Step 3: Brown the ground round steak with the onions in the skillet.
Step 4: Add the cooked spaghetti, tomato soup, and mushrooms (if desired) to the skillet.
Step 5: Season with salt, being careful not to add too much.
Step 6: Cook for 1/2 hour or more in the skillet.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Brown meat and flour in butter.
Step 2: Add mushrooms, onion, and other ingredients.
Step 3: Simmer for 2 hours.
Step 4: Add sour cream, do not let boil.
Step 5: Remove and warm in a 200°F oven.
notes: If using cooked beef, simmer thickened sauce and beef, then add sour cream. Can use microwave to reheat.

instructions: Step 1: Melt oleo in a large skillet and cook onion until yellow, stirring occasionally.
Step 2: Stir in some bread crumbs. Heat, stirring to prevent burning.
Step 3: Put into a deep bowl (or leave in pan).
Step 4: Mix in lightly seasoning, then remaining crumbs. Toss.
Step 5: For dry stuffing, add little or no water.
Step 6: For moist stuffing, mix and fork enough hot water or broth to moisten crumbs.
notes: Usually more seasoning is needed. Recipe is for a 10 lb bird, yielding 3 qts of stuffing.

instructions: Boil sauce and stir.
Brown chicken and put in roaster.
Pour on sauce and bake uncovered at 350° for 1 hour.
Baste.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

ingredients.notes: Rub a good amount over the turkey

instructions: Rub a good amount of oil or butter over the turkey.
Sprinkle the turkey very lightly with salt and flour.
Inside the turkey, rub 1 teaspoon of salt for every 5 pounds of meat.
Put the turkey in a paper bag, roll the ends tightly, and clip.
Place in a roasting pan.
Bake at 300°F. Do not open to baste.
When done, remove from oven and let stand for 5-10 minutes.
Cut the bag and lift out the turkey.
Use stock in the bottom of the paper for gravy.
notes: Cooking time varies by weight: 7-10 lbs (30 min per pound), 10-15 lbs (20 min per pound), 15-18 lbs (18 min per pound), 18-20 lbs (15 min per pound), 20-23 lbs (13 min per pound).

recipe_name: Southern Living Bar-b-que Sauce for Baked Chicken
instructions: Simmer all ingredients for 10 minutes.
Pour over chicken.
Bake, then brown.
notes: The back of the card is not visible, so additional details may be missing.

instructions: Place chicken, boned side up, on cutting board. Pound from center out with a wooden mallet to 1/4 inch. Salt.
Place ham, then cheese. Tuck sides in and roll up. Press to seal well. Skewer or tie securely.
Coat in flour and brown. Remove to 11 x 7 baking pan.
In same skillet, combine 1/2 cup water, gravy base, mushrooms, and wine. Heat, stirring to incorporate bits from skillet.
Pour mixture over chicken in pan.
Cover and bake 1-1/4 hours at 350°F.
Transfer chicken to platter. Blend 1 tablespoon flour and 1/2 cup water. Add to gravy and stir till thickened.
Pour over chicken, add almonds on top.
Pass remaining gravy. (Not good on potatoes.)
notes: Ensure chicken is sealed well to prevent cheese from leaking out.

ingredients.item: Wishbone Russian dressing or Chee Chee Ketchup

ingredients.notes: Golden onion or savory herb garlic

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 2: Skin and bone the chicken breasts.
Step 3: Mix apricot jam, Russian dressing or Chee Chee Ketchup, and onion soup mix together.
Step 4: Pour the mixture over the chicken breasts in a greased flat casserole dish.
Step 5: Bake uncovered for 45 minutes to 2 hours, depending on the number of chicken breasts used.
notes: Can use 2 whole chickens instead of chicken breasts. No additional salt needed.

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 2: Mix onion soup mix, apricot preserves, and chicken broth together.
Step 3: Place chicken breasts in a greased baking dish.
Step 4: Pour mixture over chicken.
Step 5: Bake uncovered for 45 minutes.
notes: Ensure chicken is cooked through before serving.

recipe_name: Lemony Chicken Milanese with Arugula Salad

ingredients.notes: look for panko in the Asian foods section

instructions: Using meat mallet or rolling pin, flatten chicken between sheets of plastic wrap to thickness of 1/2 inch.
Whisk eggs in medium bowl to blend.
Mix panko, 2 tablespoons parsley, oregano, salt, and pepper on plate.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs; turn to coat.
Dredge in breadcrumb mixture, coating completely.
Heat 3 tablespoons oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken and sauté until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to plates; sprinkle with lemon juice.
Toss arugula with remaining 1 tablespoon oil in medium bowl to coat; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Mound salad atop chicken.
notes: Super-easy to make and packed with flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Heat together the onion, sherry, tomato juice, paprika, salt, pepper, garlic, and water.
Step 2: Fry or broil chicken and brush with oil.
Step 3: Bake uncovered at 400°F.
Step 4: Turn after 1/2 hour.
Step 5: Baste every 10 minutes to prevent dryness.
Step 6: Turn again after 1/2 hour.
Step 7: Then bake for 15 minutes.
notes: Recipe dated 9-21-57 by 'Mother'.

ingredients.notes: chopped, peeled fresh or 1 teaspoon ground

instructions: Step 1: Pat chicken dry. Using a small, sharp knife, cut several 1/2-inch slits into each piece.
Step 2: Put chicken into a plastic bag and add remaining ingredients; gently knead bag to coat chicken pieces evenly.
Step 3: Place chicken, in its bag, in a large non-aluminum bowl (to catch any drips).
Step 4: Refrigerate for 24 to 48 hours.
Step 5: Remove chicken pieces from bag.
Step 6: Broil or barbecue chicken pieces 6-8 inches from heat source for 35 to 45 minutes, turning occasionally.
notes: 210 calories per serving

instructions: Combine orange marmalade, vinegar or lemon juice, soy sauce, and salt.
Dip chicken pieces into the mixture, then into cornflake crumbs.
Arrange in a shallow greased baking pan.
Bake at 375°F. Cover with foil for 25 minutes.
Remove foil for the last 35 minutes.
Heat remaining mixture and serve with chicken.
notes: Ensure chicken is thoroughly coated with crumbs for best results.

instructions: Step 1: Sprinkle chicken with lime juice. Dust with flour and brown in oil.
Step 2: Add tomato sauce, brown sugar, raisins, and onions.
Step 3: Cover and cook over low heat for 40 minutes until tender.
Step 4: Stir in pineapple and rum.
Step 5: Heat thoroughly and serve.
notes: A 3-legged chicken serves 6.

instructions: Step 1: Pound chicken breasts until 1/4 inch flat in a plastic bag.
Step 2: Dust with flour, salt, and pepper.
Step 3: Quickly sauté breasts in 1/4 cup butter until golden brown and cooked. This may be done ahead of time.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Step 5: Melt 1/4 cup butter and sauté onion, garlic, and mushrooms. Cook but don't brown.
Step 6: Stir in flour, celery salt, white pepper, chicken stock, and wine. Thicken over low heat for 4-5 minutes.
Step 7: Stir in mashed avocado and 1/2 cup cheese. Taste for seasoning.
Step 8: Arrange chicken breasts over avocado mixture, top with cheese.
Step 9: Bake for 10-15 minutes until melted and warmed.
notes: Ensure chicken is cooked through before baking.

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Melt butter and combine with the next 5 ingredients.
Dip chicken in butter (keep it warm) and then into bread crumbs.
Bake covered in an ungreased 9x13 Pyrex dish for 30 minutes.
Combine melted butter, wine, scallions, and parsley. Pour over chicken.
Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or longer if not warm when starting.
notes: Usually doubles.

instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients.
Heat oil.
Cook chicken slightly, then add rest of the ingredients.
Shake 5 ingredients and add.
Stir.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Make cream sauce using oleo, flour, heavy cream, milk, and Worcestershire sauce.
Step 2: Add Worcestershire sauce, chilies, and arrange mushrooms, artichokes, and chicken.
Step 3: Pour sauce over the arranged ingredients.
Step 4: Bake at 350°F until bubbly.
Step 5: Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and paprika before serving.
notes: The recipe can be adapted to include shrimp instead of chicken.

instructions: Combine first 7 ingredients.
Cover work surface with wax paper.
Place a sheet of phyllo on waxed paper and brush with butter.
Place second sheet on top and brush with butter.
Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons of sauce on each side of chicken.
Place breast in corner and fold corner over breast, then fold sides over and roll breast up in sheets to form a package.
Place on ungreased baking dish.
Repeat for remaining chicken breasts.
Brush packets with rest of butter and top with 1/2 cup of cheese.
May freeze raw. Thaw completely before baking.
Bake at 375°F for 30 to 40 minutes.
notes: Do not use cookie sheet for baking.

instructions: Step 1: Heat oven to 375°F. Mix butter and mustard in shallow dish until well mixed. Mix bread crumbs and cheese in large plastic bag.

Step 2: Dip one piece of chicken at a time into butter mixture, coating all sides. Then place in bag of bread crumbs, seal bag and shake to coat with crumb mixture. Place chicken in single layer in ungreased rectangular pan, 13x9x2 inches.
Step 3: Bake uncovered 20 to 30 minutes, turning once, until juice of chicken is no longer pink when centers of thickest pieces are cut.
Step 4: Cook 15 minutes, turn.
Step 5: Bake 5 minutes, remove from oven.
Step 6: Let sit, return to oven for 5-10 minutes to reheat and crisp.
Step 7: Sprinkle with parsley.
notes: Top rack to brown. Adjust cooking time as needed for crispiness.

instructions: Step 1: Combine marinade ingredients and add shrimp.
Step 2: Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
Step 3: Place shrimp on skewers (or not).
Step 4: Grill 2-3 minutes per side or use the panini press to grill.
notes: Marinate shrimp for better flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Combine soy sauce, oil, minced garlic, honey, ginger, and dry mustard to create the marinade.
Step 2: Marinate pork tenderloins for 24 hours, turning occasionally.
Step 3: Grill pork tenderloins until well done, approximately 30 to 45 minutes.
Step 4: Alternatively, bake in the oven at 350°F for 1 to 1.5 hours.
Step 5: For sweet sour sauce, combine orange marmalade, vinegar, chopped pimento, paprika, and salt. Heat the mixture.
Step 6: For mustard sauce, stir dry mustard into boiling water and add salt.
Step 7: Serve pork tenderloins with the prepared sauces.
notes: Ensure to marinate the pork for the full 24 hours for best flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Cover pork with 1/2 of the marinade mixture.
Step 2: Cover and chill for 1 hour, turning occasionally.
Step 3: Baste with remaining sauce while cooking.
Step 4: Baste with the first half and serve the second half at the table.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional information is provided.

instructions: Step 1: Rub the garlic over the lamb and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Step 2: Bake at 325°F.
Step 3: Baste with wine and lemon.
Step 4: To grill, place the lamb fat side up over medium coals.
Step 5: Grill for 50-60 minutes, basting occasionally.
notes: Ensure to baste regularly for added flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Put lamb on rack in pan and preheat oven to 325°F.
Step 2: Combine all ingredients except the last two (cornstarch and cold water) over low heat.
Step 3: Stir cornstarch into cold water and add to sauce, stirring constantly.
Step 4: Simmer for 3 minutes or until thick and clear.
Step 5: Baste lamb every 10-15 minutes.
Step 6: Roast for 1 1/2 - 2 hours until internal temperature reaches 170°F for medium doneness.
Step 7: Serves 8 or more.
notes: Ensure lamb is basted regularly for best flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Spread mayonnaise on salmon fillets to prevent sticking to the grill.
Step 2: Baste with a mixture of honey, brown sugar, and butter while grilling.
notes: The back of the card is blank, so no additional instructions or information are provided.

instructions: Step 1: Place salmon in a shallow dish.
Step 2: Combine next six ingredients. Pour over salmon and let marinate 1 hour.
Step 3: Remove steaks and brush with oil.
Step 4: Place under a medium-hot broiler and broil 7 to 8 minutes on each side, occasionally brushing with marinade.
Step 5: Sprinkle with crumbs and broil 2 to 3 minutes more on each side.
notes: Marinate for 1 hour before cooking.

ingredients.notes: Salt and pepper inside and outside
Wrap fish in heavy foil, include butter and water

instructions: Step 1: Salt and pepper the fish inside and outside.
Step 2: Wrap the fish in heavy foil, including butter and water.
Step 3: Prepare the baste by mixing butter, lemon, salt, paprika, and parsley flakes.
Step 4: Grill the fish for 5 minutes per pound on each side, basting occasionally.
notes: Ensure the foil is wrapped tightly to retain moisture.

ingredients.notes: I might add a little more

instructions: Grill burgers approximately 6-7 minutes on each side.
Check for doneness.
notes: Enjoy the rest of your summer, Marnie!

instructions: Step 1: Place shrimp in a medium bowl. Add oil, tequila, cayenne, garlic, and chili sauce. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
Step 2: Prepare a hot grill. Remove shrimp and thread on metal skewers.
Step 3: Place on grill rack, basting frequently with marinade and turning once, until shrimp are pink and loosely curled, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
notes: Refrigeration time is 1 to 2 hours.

instructions: Step 1: Combine olive oil, soy sauce, honey, rosemary, garlic, pepper, and salt in a bowl.
Step 2: Add flank steaks to the marinade and coat well.
Step 3: Marinate overnight in the refrigerator.
Step 4: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Step 5: Grill steaks for 4-5 minutes per side.
Step 6: Let the steaks rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
cooking_time: 4-5 minutes per side, plus overnight marination
notes: Ensure to marinate the steaks overnight for best flavor.

instructions: Step 1: Combine soy sauce, pineapple juice, sherry, brown sugar, pressed garlic, and grated ginger root in a bowl.
Step 2: Marinate pork tenderloins in the mixture for 6 hours or overnight.
Step 3: Whisk together 1/4 cup corn starch and 1/2 cup water.
Step 4: Bring reserved marinade to a boil.
Step 5: Gradually add corn starch mixture to the boiling marinade, letting the sauce thicken.
Step 6: Serve the sauce warm over the pork.
notes: Ensure the marinade is reserved for making the sauce.

instructions: Marinate the steak in soy sauce, water, garlic, sugar, and ginger for at least 5 hours or more.
At least 1 hour before cooking, soak hickory chips in water.
Sprinkle soaked chips on coals as you start cooking.
Place grill 1 1/2 inches above hot coals.
Remove steak from marinade and grill about 4 minutes on each side.
Cover loosely with foil when grilling the second side to prevent meat from cooking too fast.
Slice steak at a 45-degree angle about 3/8 inch thick and arrange slices on a platter.
notes: Marinate for more flavor. Use hickory chips for a smoky taste.

instructions: Step 1: Combine sugar, vinegar, Worcestershire, butter, and chili sauce in a pot.
Step 2: Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 3: Cook until the mixture thickens, at least 10 minutes.
Step 4: Serve hot over shrimp on bib lettuce.
Step 5: Serve with rolls.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Mix all ingredients together.
Step 2: Marinate tenderloin in the morning, cover with foil.
Step 3: Let sit 1/2 time and cover.
Step 4: Before cooking, bring out and drain.
Step 5: Baste while broiling.
notes: Will freeze for reuse or can be stored in the fridge for one week.

instructions: Step 1: Put the first 5 ingredients in a processor and blend until smooth.
Step 2: Turn slowly and add oil.
Step 3: Thin the sauce slowly.
Step 4: Toss with hot linguine.
notes: Great for pasta dishes.

instructions: Step 1: Combine lime juice, olive oil, dry sherry, cilantro, soy sauce, honey, garlic, Dijon mustard, ginger, and crushed red pepper in a bowl.
Step 2: Marinate meat for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Reserve marinade for sauce.
Step 3: Grill or broil meat as desired.
Step 4: Bring reserved marinade to a boil and reduce heat.
Step 5: Whisk in butter slices one at a time.
Step 6: Do not boil after adding butter. Serve as sauce.
cooking_time: 30 minutes to 1 hour marinating, plus grilling time
notes: Ensure not to boil the sauce after adding butter to maintain a smooth consistency.

recipe_name: A gingery sauce for seafood or chicken
instructions: Whisk all ingredients with a fork.
Use as a dipping sauce for sushi or as a basting sauce for cooking.
Mix with 1/2 pound (2 sticks) of butter to make a compound butter.
Refrigerate and use to finish fish or sesame chicken.
notes: The back of the card does not contain additional recipe information.

ingredients.notes: If not available, increase red wine vinegar to 2 cups.

instructions: Step 1: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Step 2: Reduce heat to medium and cook uncovered until thick (about 1 hour), stirring occasionally.
Step 3: Discard cloves and cinnamon.
Step 4: Store leftover chutney in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
notes: If raspberry vinegar is not available, increase red wine vinegar to 2 cups.

instructions: Step 1: Stir over low heat until jelly is melted.
Step 2: Increase heat to medium and just bring to boil.
Step 3: Remove and let cool to room temperature.
notes: Less vinegar for sauce. Recipe is for leg of lamb.

instructions: Put all ingredients except butter into Osterizer container, cover and begin to process at Lo.
Immediately remove feeder cap and pour butter in a steady stream until mixture is completely emulsified.
This may be kept warm over hot water, but do not let water boil.
notes: Hollandaise Sauce can be made quickly and easily in your Osterizer blender with this easy-to-make recipe.

ingredients.notes: add after flour has begun to cook, then heat again

instructions: Cook in double boiler until flour is cooked and thickened (at least 10 min.).
Pour onto 3 egg yolks and return to double boiler.
Cook 2 or 3 minutes (like a custard).
notes: Really good!

instructions: Step 1: Heat all ingredients except vinegar together in a saucepan.
Step 2: When cool, add vinegar and boil for 2 minutes.
notes: Good for both ham and tongue.

instructions: Spoon over hot beans, asparagus, etc.
Add paprika.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

ingredients.notes: canned, heat in own juice, strain, and add

instructions: Step 1: Brown 4 T. butter.
Step 2: Stir in 4 T. flour.
Step 3: Add 2 C. brown stock and season.
Step 4: Heat mushrooms in own juice (canned), strain, and add.

instructions: Step 1: Bring cranberries, boiling water, and sugar to a quick boil.
Step 2: Boil for 5 minutes.
Step 3: Let stand for 5 minutes.
Step 4: Boil for another 5 minutes.
Step 5: Finish.
notes: The recipe is noted as 'Great!'

instructions: Step 1: Mix 2 T water and 1 T cornstarch together.
Step 2: Mix remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.
Step 3: Cool to serve.

instructions: Cook yams till soft. Drain.
Combine all ingredients and mix with mixer until light.
Put in bowl and add topping.
Bake 35 minutes at 350°F.
Can be made ahead without topping.
Take out of refrigerator and warm to room temperature.
Fluff the yams, then add topping.
notes: Can be made ahead without topping.

instructions: Step 1: Wash potatoes. Bake 1 hour or until done. Cool to touch.
Step 2: Cut a lengthwise strip from top of potatoes and discard. Carefully scoop out pulp, leaving 1/4 inch thick shell.
Step 3: Mash potato; add 1/4 cup butter; stir until melted.
Step 4: Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and next 3 ingredients. Whip with wire whisk until smooth.
Step 5: Spoon or pipe into shells.
Step 6: Combine coconut, pecans, 1/4 cup brown sugar. Cut in 3 tablespoons butter until crumbly.
Step 7: Sprinkle mixture over potatoes. Place on baking sheet.
Step 8: Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
notes: Ensure potatoes are cool enough to handle before scooping.

ingredients.notes: Unpeeled or peeled, as desired, cut into fourths

instructions: Mix flour, cheese, salt, and pepper in a bag.
Moisten potatoes with water and shake a few at a time in the bag, coating each potato well with the cheese mixture.
Melt butter in a large baking pan (depending upon the amount of potatoes, a 9-by-13 pan works well).
Put potatoes in a single layer in the pan.
Bake at 375°F for about 1 hour, turning potatoes halfway through baking time.
Serve hot.
notes: Ensure potatoes are well coated with the cheese mixture for best flavor.

ingredients.notes: Skin on, whole or in large cubes

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Step 2: Prepare 2 pounds of red potatoes with skin on, either whole or cut into large cubes.
Step 3: Drizzle potatoes with olive oil or margarine.
Step 4: Place potatoes in a plastic bag with Lipton onion soup mix.
Step 5: Shake the bag to coat the potatoes and let sit for 30 minutes.
Step 6: Bake in the oven for 30-40 minutes.
notes: The back of the card is not visible, so additional instructions or notes may be missing.

instructions: Boil and peel potatoes, then rice.
When partly cool, add egg, salt, and pepper.
If too dry, add milk.
Flour hands if necessary, form into 8 round balls with marshmallows inside.
Roll in flakes.
Fry in Crisco until bread crumbs brown (40 seconds).
Drain on soft paper.
Can be reheated.
notes: Ensure marshmallows are fully enclosed in the sweet potato mixture before frying.

instructions: Step 1: Place potatoes in cold water with 1 tablespoon of kosher salt to cover. Simmer until tender.
Step 2: Heat half and half and butter in a saucepan.
Step 3: Mash potatoes on low heat. Slowly add hot cream and butter.
Step 4: Mash by hand. Fold in sour cream, Parmesan cheese, and fresh ground pepper.
Step 5: Add garlic to taste.
notes: Best mashed by hand.

instructions: Step 1: Boil potatoes until tender.
Step 2: Drain and beat potatoes until fluffy and creamy.
Step 3: Adjust seasoning.
Step 4: Place potatoes in greased 2 qt. casserole.
Step 5: Fold cheese into whipped cream and spread over potatoes.
Step 6: Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
notes: Ensure potatoes are well seasoned before baking.

instructions: Step 1: Mix the first 7 ingredients at low speed.
Step 2: Stir in pineapple, 1/2 cup nuts, raisins, and coconut.
Step 3: Spoon lightly into a greased 8-inch square baking dish.
Step 4: Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup pecans.
Step 5: Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Step 6: Sprinkle with marshmallows and bake until melted.
notes: Ensure to drain the canned sweet potatoes and pineapple before use.

ingredients.notes: Use as needed to fill baking dish
Pour over to 1/2 to 3/4 inch from top

instructions: Step 1: Thinly slice the potatoes and place them in a greased baking dish.
Step 2: Sprinkle each layer of potatoes with chilies, smoked cheddar, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Step 3: Pour hot milk over the layers until it reaches 1/2 to 3/4 inch from the top of the dish.
Step 4: Bake uncovered at 350°F for 1 1/4 hours or until tender.
Step 5: Top with additional cheese if needed to brown.
notes: Ensure the milk is hot before pouring over the potatoes.

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F. Position oven rack in the lowest third of the oven.
Step 2: Place potatoes in a roasting pan.
Step 3: Add olive oil and dried crushed red pepper to the potatoes and toss to coat.
Step 4: Season with salt and pepper.
Step 5: Bake until tender inside and crisp on the outside, turning once, about 1 hour or less.
Step 6: Sprinkle with Parmesan and basil before serving.
notes: Recipe from Bon Appétit, cover 9/92.

instructions: Mix all ingredients except hash browns and cheese.
Add hash browns and mix well.
Put into greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
In the last 10 minutes, add cheese on top.
notes: Ensure hash browns are thawed before mixing.

ingredients.notes: Mix together with other dry ingredients
Mix together with other dry ingredients
Mix together with other dry ingredients
Wash, core, and slice 1/4 to 1/3 inch thick

instructions: Step 1: Mix flour, corn meal, and salt together.
Step 2: Wash, core, and slice 4 large green tomatoes 1/4 to 1/3 inch thick.
Step 3: Coat the tomato slices with the flour mixture.
Step 4: Brown on one side in 1/4 cup hot oil and 1/4 cup butter over medium-high heat for 2-3 minutes per side.
Step 5: Sprinkle the browned side with sugar, turn over, and brown the other side.
Step 6: Sprinkle the other side with black pepper.
Step 7: Do not overcook. Serve immediately.
notes: Ensure not to overcook to maintain the texture of the tomatoes.

instructions: Step 1: Soak rice overnight.
Step 2: Put in greased casserole.
Step 3: Mix with other ingredients.
Step 4: Add salt and pepper.
Step 5: Bake 1 hour at 350-375°F uncovered.
notes: Good the next day. Can also cook ahead and warm up for a party.

instructions: Step 1: Cut corn off the cob.
Step 2: Peel tomatoes.
Step 3: Chop green pepper.
Step 4: Mix corn, tomatoes, and green pepper in a greased casserole dish.
Step 5: Add sugar, salt, and lots of pepper to the mixture.
Step 6: Cover with bread crumbs, then add butter.
Step 7: Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes.
notes: Ensure to use fresh ingredients for best flavor.

instructions: Beat eggs and add dry ingredients. Mix well.
Add baking powder and milk. Mix well.
Pour into greased casserole.
Bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes. Longer if cold.
notes: The back of the card is blank.

instructions: Step 1: Blanch broccoli florets.
Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Step 3: Add garlic and cook for 1 minute, then remove.
Step 4: Add broccoli and toss to coat in oil.
Step 5: Add lemon zest and pancetta, then season with salt and pepper.
Step 6: Toss to combine and serve.
Step 7: For baby carrots, blanch for 6-8 minutes.
Step 8: Melt butter in a skillet, stir in brown sugar and mustard.
Step 9: Toss carrots in the mixture and cook for 1 more minute.
notes: The recipe includes a side dish of baby carrots with a sweet mustard glaze.

instructions: Step 1: Boil cream and shallots in a heavy pot over medium heat for 2 minutes.
Step 2: Add mushrooms and 1/4 cup Marsala.
Step 3: Reduce heat to medium and simmer until mushrooms are evenly coated, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes.
Step 4: Add remaining 1/4 cup Marsala.
Step 5: Simmer until mushrooms are tender and sauce thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, stirring occasionally, about 6 minutes.
Step 6: Stir in chopped thyme and simmer for 1 minute.
Step 7: Season to taste.
notes: Make ahead if desired.

ingredients.notes: Peeled, cored, and cut into eighths

instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Scrub the potatoes, prick them several times with a knife or fork, and bake them for 1 hour, or until very soft when pierced with a knife.
Remove from the oven and scoop out the insides as soon as they are cool enough to handle.
Place the sweet potato meat into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and add the orange juice, cream, butter, brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Mix together until combined but not smooth, and pour into a baking dish.
For the topping, melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the apple wedges and brown sugar and cook for about 5 to 10 minutes, until lightly browned on both sides.
Place on top of the sweet potatoes.
Bake the potatoes and apples for 20 to 30 minutes, until heated through.
notes: Substitute caramelized apples for marshmallows for a natural sweetness.

instructions: Step 1: Cook spinach and drain well.
Step 2: Add butter to spinach.
Step 3: Mix sour cream and soup mix together and add to spinach.
Step 4: Drain artichoke hearts, cut into pieces, and place in the bottom of a flat casserole.
Step 5: Spread spinach mixture over artichokes.
Step 6: Top with stuffing.
Step 7: Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
notes: Hope you enjoy the recipe. It's one of our favorites.

instructions: Step 1: Mix Bisquick, Parmesan cheese, and pepper in a bowl.
Step 2: Stir in eggs.
Step 3: Fold in shredded zucchini.
Step 4: Melt butter in skillet over medium heat.
Step 5: Use 2 tablespoons of mixture per round (or more if desired).
Step 6: Cook 2-3 minutes on each side or until brown.
notes: Recipe can be doubled or increased by 1.5 times.

instructions: Step 1: Sauté zucchini and garlic until crisp.
Step 2: Mix beaten eggs, milk, chopped onion, Parmesan cheese, oregano, salt, pepper, margarine, parsley, garlic powder, and basil.
Step 3: Cook until zucchini is tender and crisp.
Step 4: Pour mixture over potato crust.
Step 5: Bake at 350°F for 35 to 45 minutes.
notes: Needs more flavor; check zucchini pie recipe for adjustments.

instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Step 2: Cut vegetables into small pieces.
Step 3: Toss vegetables with olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper.
Step 4: Spread vegetables on a baking sheet.
Step 5: Bake for 20 to 40 minutes, depending on the type of vegetable and desired doneness.
Step 6: Toast vegetables before baking for extra crispness.
Step 7: Sprinkle parsley over baked vegetables before serving.
notes: Adjust baking time based on vegetable type and desired crispness.

ingredients.notes: cut slice from top, scoop out centers

ingredients.amount: 1 can (12 oz) or 1/2 cup fresh cooked

instructions: Cut slice from top of tomatoes, scoop out centers, and mix pulp with other ingredients.
Fill centers of tomatoes with mixture.
Bake in muffin cups or greased baking pan.
Bake for about 30 minutes at 350°F.
notes: Source of recipe: Enquirer

instructions: Step 1: Scrub and cut off ends of squash. Put in boiling water for 7 minutes. Drain and cool slightly.
Step 2: Cut in half lengthwise and lay upside down. Scoop out inside.
Step 3: Mix the scooped-out insides with stuffing, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, onion, and beaten egg.
Step 4: If mixture is runny, add more stuffing.
Step 5: Fill squash halves with the mixture.
Step 6: Dot with butter.
Step 7: Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
notes: Ensure squash is not overcooked in boiling water to maintain structure.

instructions: Measure bread crumbs lightly.
Put spinach in a casserole dish.
Beat eggs lightly and add salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Cook cheese and milk until cheese melts.
Pour egg mixture over spinach.
Pour cheese mixture gently over the above.
Cover with buttered crumbs.
Bake in 375°F oven for about 30 minutes.
Place under broiler to brown if necessary.
notes: Ensure spinach is defrosted before use.

ingredients.notes: if can't find, use extra of the others

instructions: Rinse the squash but do not peel. Cut off the stem ends and then cut into 1/2 inch slices.
Slice pattypan from above, not across.
Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in a 5 qt. kettle, add bouillon and sliced squash.
Cover and boil gently until squash is just tender (5-8 min). Drain.
Shake together salt, pepper, and oregano.
Arrange half of squash in a greased baking dish.
Sprinkle with 1/2 of spice mixture and 1/2 Jack cheese. Repeat layers.
Melt butter and stir in nuts but do not allow to toast.
Spoon over vegetables, top with Parmesan and bake uncovered in a 300°F oven for 15 min.
notes: Ensure to not toast the nuts when stirring them into the melted butter.

ingredients.notes: slice with large grate on cheese grater

instructions: Step 1: Sauté onions in butter and olive oil until transparent.
Step 2: Slice zucchini with large grate on cheese grater.
Step 3: Add chicken base to onions and heat zucchini for 3 minutes or less.
Step 4: Add cheese to the mixture.
Step 5: Stuff the mixture into hollow tomatoes.
Step 6: Top with additional parmesan cheese.
Step 7: Heat at 350°F for 10-15 minutes.
notes: Ensure tomatoes are hollow before stuffing.

instructions: Step 1: Combine all vegetables except radishes in a large bowl.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, mix vegetable oil, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and pepper to create the marinade.
Step 3: Pour the marinade over the vegetables and mix well.
Step 4: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
Step 5: Add radishes before serving.
notes: Adjust sugar to taste. Onion is optional.

instructions: Step 1: Cook mushrooms, onions, and 1/2 cup nuts in butter.
Step 2: Add flour, seasoning, and blend.
Step 3: Add milk and make a smooth sauce.
Step 4: Add 1 cup cheese, pepper sauce, lemon juice, and cook over low heat until melted.
Step 5: Add beans and pour into a 2-quart casserole.
Step 6: Bake in 350°F oven for 15 minutes.
Step 7: Then top with remaining cheese and bake only until cheese on top is melted.
notes: Recipe from the file of Betty Voorkies.

instructions: Step 1: For spinach filling, combine all ingredients except dough and butter. Set aside.
Step 2: Unroll phyllo dough. Grease cookie sheet.
Step 3: Layer 4 sheets of dough on pan brushing each sheet with butter. Don’t worry about rips in dough.
Step 4: Spoon half of spinach filling down long edge, and roll jelly-roll fashion.
Step 5: Cut 1/2 way through in 1-inch slices. Drizzle with melted butter.
Step 6: Repeat process with remaining phyllo dough and spinach filling.
Step 7: Bake in preheated 400° oven 20 to 30 minutes.
notes: Delicious! Freezes well. Just heat 5 minutes in hot oven to serve.

ingredients.notes: Select tender stalks, split large heads
Halve, dice, or quarter; remove seeds
Pour boiling water over, peel, pack tightly
Use on the cob, cut after blanching

instructions: Wash vegetables thoroughly.
Blanch vegetables using a frying basket in boiling water, then begin timing.
Cool by plunging vegetables in cold water until chilled.
Put in freezer immediately.
Beans: Blanch 3 minutes in 4 qts of water per 1 lb.
Broccoli: Blanch 3-4 minutes, split large heads.
Peppers: Blanch halves for 3 minutes, quarters for 2.5 minutes, slices for 2 minutes.
Tomatoes: No blanching needed, pour boiling water, peel, pack tightly.
Zucchini: Wash and freeze.
Corn: Use on the cob, freeze shortly after picking, cut after blanching.
Corn blanching times: 7 minutes for small ears, 9 minutes for medium ears, 11 minutes for large ears.
notes: Adapted from 'The Freezer Cookbook' by Charlotte Erickson, Chilton Book Co.

instructions: Step 1: Make a cream sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
Step 2: Add cooked and strained carrots to the cream sauce.
Step 3: Mix in egg yolks, grated cheese, and salt.
Step 4: Fold the mixture into beaten stiff egg whites.
Step 5: Bake in a casserole in a pan of water at 350°F for 40 minutes.
notes: With corn, add green pepper.

ingredients.amount: slightly less than 1 oz per pepper

instructions: Step 1: Cut and clean peppers. Ensure they have the flattest side on the bottom.
Step 2: Clean and quarter mushrooms. Sauté to prevent excess juice during baking.
Step 3: Mix olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Step 4: Drizzle the mixture evenly over each pepper, about 1 tbsp per serving.
Step 5: Bake in a baking dish at 375°F for 40 minutes. Note: Cooking time might be 5-10 minutes too short.
notes: Adjust cooking time if needed. Ensure peppers are evenly sized for consistent cooking.

recipe_name: Broccoli with Toasted Garlic and Hazelnuts

ingredients.notes: Spread on a rimmed baking sheet

instructions: Step 1: Heat oven to 375°F. Spread the hazelnuts on a rimmed baking sheet and toast, tossing occasionally, until fragrant, 5 to 6 minutes; roughly chop.

Step 2: Meanwhile, fill a large saucepan with 1 inch of water and fit with a steamer basket (or fill a large pot with 1/2 inch of water). Bring to a simmer. Place the broccoli in the steamer basket, cover, and steam until tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a platter.

Step 3: Meanwhile in a small saucepan, cook the oil and garlic over low heat until the garlic is just golden, 4 to 6 minutes. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in the hazelnuts, lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Drizzle over the broccoli.
notes: Ensure to monitor the garlic closely to prevent burning.

instructions: Step 1: Sprinkle garlic with salt and sugar. Mash with a wooden spoon.
Step 2: Beat garlic into olive oil, lemon juice, and onion.
Step 3: Stir in cheese and sour cream.
Step 4: Chill at least 1 hour before serving.
Step 5: Serve at room temperature with asparagus.

ingredients.notes: for adding after yeast is foamy

instructions: Step 1: Mix yeast, 1/2 cup warm water, and sugar or honey.
Step 2: When yeast is foamy, add 2 1/2 cups flour and 2 cups warm water.
Step 3: Place in a large crock or glass jar (not metal) and cover with a damp cloth and rubber band.
Step 4: Keep at room temperature for 5 days, stirring daily with a wooden spoon.
Step 5: After 5 days, feed Herman with 1 cup flour, 1 cup milk, and 3/4 cup sugar.
Step 6: Keep covered under a damp towel at room temperature.
Step 7: On the 10th day, feed again with the same amounts: 1 cup flour, 1 cup milk, and 3/4 cup sugar.
Step 8: Herman is now ready to be divided and baked. Use two cups for baking.
Step 9: Save 1 cup and continue feeding on the 5th and 10th day for future use.
Step 10: Give two cups away to friends.
notes: This is a sourdough starter recipe that requires regular feeding and maintenance.

instructions: Combine flour, salt, sugar, and yeast in a large mixing bowl. Gradually stir in warm water until mixture forms a smooth paste.
Cover with a clean towel or several layers of cheesecloth and stand in a warm place (85 degrees) to sour and bubble for 2 to 3 days, stirring twice a day.
At end of bubbling and souring period, pour into large jar or container partially covered to allow gases to escape. Store in refrigerator. Makes 3 cups.
Mix starter, flour, milk, and sugar together and store in a large bowl or a 5-pound plastic container in refrigerator. Stir down daily.
On the fifth day, feed again with same amounts of flour, milk, and sugar.
On the 10th day, remove 1 cup to feed and store again and 1 cup to give away. Use remainder of starter for cake.
Add to 1 cup of the starter the flour, eggs, oil, salt, soda, cinnamon, and nuts or raisins.
Pour into a greased 9 by 13 by 2-inch pan and top with mixture of brown sugar, cinnamon, flour, and butter.
Bake in a 350-degree oven for 40 minutes. Cool and drizzle with confectioners' sugar icing.
notes: The starter needs to be prepared and maintained over a period of 10 days.

instructions: Step 1: Soften yeast in warm water.
